Class Screen

  • java.lang.Object
    • Screen
  • public class Screen
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the Screen that the user interacts with, and handles all input and output for the game.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean attemptPart​(Player player)
      Writes a prompt for the user to input whether or not they want to try to take a Part in the same turn that they have moved.
      java.lang.String getCurrency​(Player player, int rank, int[] creditPrices, int[] dollarPrices)
      Writes a prompt for the user to input the currency they wish to use for their upgrade, then waits for valid input to return.
      static Screen getInstance()
      Ensures exactly one Screen exists and returns it.
      Part getPart​(Player player)
      Writes a prompt for the user to input the Part they would like to take, then waits for valid Part name to return.
      int getPlayerAction​(Player player)
      Writes a prompt for the user to input their next action for the current turn, then waits for valid input to return.
      int getPlayerCount()
      Writes a prompt for the user to input the number of Players, then waits for valid input to return.
      int getRank​(Player player, int[] creditPrices, int[] dollarPrices)
      Writes a prompt for the user to input the rank they would like to upgrade to, then waits for valid input to return.
      Room getRoom​(Player player)
      Writes a prompt for the user to input the Room they would like to move to, then waits for a valid Room name to return.
      void listPlayers​(Player[] players)
      Lists all Players and their positions on the Board.
      void writePlayerInfo​(Player player, int playerNumber)
      Writes the information that each user will see when beginning their turn.
      void writeResetMessage()
      Writes a message informing the user that the day has been reset.
      void writeResponse​(int action, int outputType)
      Writes the appropriate response to a given action that the Player takes, using the given output type.
      void writeScores​(int[] scores)
      Writes all of the Players' scores at the end of the game, using the inputted array of scores.

      • writePlayerInfo

        public void writePlayerInfo​(Player player,
                            int playerNumber)
        Writes the information that each user will see when beginning their turn.
        Parameters:
        player - the Player whose prompt will be written.
        playerNumber - the number that identifies the Player.

      • writeResponse

        public void writeResponse​(int action,
                          int outputType)
        Writes the appropriate response to a given action that the Player takes, using the given output type.
        Parameters:
        action - the action that was performed to initiate this response.
        outputType - the type of output to be written.

      • listPlayers

        public void listPlayers​(Player[] players)
        Lists all Players and their positions on the Board.
        Parameters:
        players - all of the Players represented by a Player array.

      • attemptPart

        public boolean attemptPart​(Player player)
        Writes a prompt for the user to input whether or not they want to try to take a Part in the same turn that they have moved.
        Parameters:
        player - the Player that will attempt to take a Part.
        Returns:
        whether or not the user inputted 'yes'.

      • writeResetMessage

        public void writeResetMessage()
        Writes a message informing the user that the day has been reset.

      • writeScores

        public void writeScores​(int[] scores)
        Writes all of the Players' scores at the end of the game, using the inputted array of scores.
        Parameters:
        scores - the integer array representing all of the Players' scores.

      • getPlayerCount

        public int getPlayerCount()
        Writes a prompt for the user to input the number of Players, then waits for valid input to return.
        Returns:
        the number of Players in the game.

      • getPlayerAction

        public int getPlayerAction​(Player player)
        Writes a prompt for the user to input their next action for the current turn, then waits for valid input to return.
        Parameters:
        player - the Player that will perform the chosen action.
        Returns:
        the integer code representing a valid action.

      • getRoom

        public Room getRoom​(Player player)
        Writes a prompt for the user to input the Room they would like to move to, then waits for a valid Room name to return.
        Parameters:
        player - the Player who will move to the new Room.
        Returns:
        the Room the Player will move to.

      • getPart

        public Part getPart​(Player player)
        Writes a prompt for the user to input the Part they would like to take, then waits for valid Part name to return.
        Parameters:
        player - the Player that will take the new Part.
        Returns:
        the Part the Player is going to take.

      • getRank

        public int getRank​(Player player,
                   int[] creditPrices,
                   int[] dollarPrices)
        Writes a prompt for the user to input the rank they would like to upgrade to, then waits for valid input to return.
        Parameters:
        player - the Player whose rank will be upgraded.
        creditPrices - the integer array representing the credit prices for upgrades.
        dollarPrices - the integer array representing the dollar prices for upgrades.
        Returns:
        the integer representing a valid rank.

      • getCurrency

        public java.lang.String getCurrency​(Player player,
                                    int rank,
                                    int[] creditPrices,
                                    int[] dollarPrices)
        Writes a prompt for the user to input the currency they wish to use for their upgrade, then waits for valid input to return.
        Parameters:
        player - the Player whose rank will be upgraded.
        rank - the rank the Player will upgrade to.
        creditPrices - the integer array representing the credit prices for upgrades.
        dollarPrices - the integer array representing the dollar prices for upgrades.
        Returns:
        the String representing the currency the Player will use.
